meanings.definition: Located at or near the front
meanings.sent1: The frontest seat in the classroom is right by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The frontest row at the concert was filled with excited fans.
meanings.sent3: The frontest spot in the line for ice cream always gets the best flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her frontest position in the race made her feel like a champion.
meanings.sent5: The frontest part of the roller coaster had the most thrilling drop.

meanings.sent1: The frontest car in the train is the engine.
meanings.sent2: The frontest player on the soccer team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: The frontest slice of pizza disappeared first at the party.
meanings.sent4: His frontest move in the game surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The frontest row of flowers in the garden looked the brightest.

meanings.definition: To be in the forefront or leading position
meanings.sent1: She frontests the team with her exceptional leadership skills.
meanings.sent2: The company frontests the industry with innovative technology.
meanings.sent3: He frontests the group in every hiking expedition.
meanings.sent4: Their dedication frontests all others in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The captain frontests the ship through stormy waters.
